title: Astro Photography
subtitle: Come on a cosmic adventure between science and Andean Cosmovision
description: In the heart of the world's driest desert, we invite you to a dual experience: a journey through the visible universe with cutting‑edge science and a connection to the cosmos through ancestral wisdom. We don't sell tours, we offer a connection.

experience.title: Two Perspectives, One Sky
experience.science_description: Equipped with 16‑inch telescopes, our expert guides will take you on a rigorous and fascinating tour. Observe the dance of Jupiter’s moons, Saturn’s rings, and the nebulae where stars are born. Understand the cosmos with the clarity that only Atacama can provide.
experience.ancestral_description: Beyond science, Atacama’s sky is a map of stories. Our local guides will share the Andean Cosmovision, teaching you to read the constellations that guided their ancestors. It’s an invitation to feel the universe, not just observe it.

about.title: A Gateway to the Universe
about.content: San Pedro de Atacama is not just a destination; it's a global epicenter for astrotourism. With over 300 clear nights a year, a privileged altitude, and a strict Luminous Standard that protects its skies, we offer a pristine window to the cosmos. Here, the science of cutting-edge observatories and ancient Andean wisdom come together to provide an unforgettable experience.

premium.title: Premium Scientific Tour
premium.description: A deep dive into the cosmos with a scientific focus and luxury comfort.

features.3: Glass of wine and premium catering

cultural.title: Andean Cosmovision Tour
cultural.description: Connect with the universe through the wisdom of the native peoples.

features.0: Interpretation of the sky according to the Lickanantay culture
features.4: Guided by members of the local community

gallery.title: Your Digital Memory of the Cosmos
gallery.subtitle: Astrophotography is the heart of our experience. You don't just take a memory with you; you become part of Atacama's stellar landscape.

calendar.title: Lunar Calendar for Observation
calendar.description: The best nights for stargazing are close to the New Moon. Use our calendar to find the darkest skies and book your tour.
